intro: Randia oxypetala, commonly known as the sharp-leaved randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Randia oxypetala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
